cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico and 115 mi SSW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwestward, forecast to cross the NE Yucatan on Wednesday, then track over the central Gulf of Mexico toward the central–western Louisiana coast late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coastline (between Lake Charles and Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory 7A
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory 7A
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward to the Florida Panhandle, with greatest threat over Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Friday with a low (≤17 %) chance of 50-kt gusts if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge (2–4 ft) could affect Sabine Lake and adjacent upper-TX coast if Delta approaches closer than currently forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday–Saturday could deposit 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and possible port access restrictions/closures beginning late Thursday.
